vectorData.altText: 23. Identify the class of epithelium A. Be specific.
That's right! Respiratory epithelium can be identified by the pseudostratified ciliated columnar epithelial cells. Faintly stained goblet cells are also seen.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

Pseudostratified     epithelium gives the appearance of being stratified, but all cells contact the basement membrane, so it is a simple epithelium
is usually ciliated, esp. in respiratory tract, where it works with goblet cells to clean inspired air before it is exposed to the gas exchange surfaces of the lung 
Pseudostratified ciliated columnar epithelium with goblet cells is also known as respiratory epithelium
pseudo = false; giving the appearance of something it’s not; for example the pseudoGucci purse I bought for $17 at Value Village
